thread.title: Dozens displaced as fire races through Oak Park apartment building - Oak Leaves
thread.title_full: Dozens displaced as fire races through Oak Park apartment building - Oak Leaves

author: Steve Schering
title: Dozens displaced as fire races through Oak Park apartment building - Oak Leaves
text:
A fire destroyed an Oak Park apartment building Tuesday night, displacing dozens of residents who lived in the 22-unit structure.
According to the Oak Park Fire Department, firefighters responded to the fire in the 200 block of Washington Boulevard around 9:30 p.m.
“The rear of the building was totally involved, from the ground level to the roof,” said Battalion Chief Donald Bush. “[Firefighters] did enter the structure to alert the occupants to get out. At some point pretty quickly, conditions became untenable and we had to retreat from the structure.”
According to officials, the roof collapsed, and much of the top floor was gutted.
“I would say the building is a total loss,” Bush said.
Authorities used a Pace bus to keep residents warm as crews battled the blaze.
According to Bush, one firefighter was transported to an area hospital for “non-life threatening injuries.” None of the building’s residents were injured, Bush said.
Crews remained on the scene Wednesday morning battling hot spots, Bush said, and fire investigators planned to visit the site later in the day to determine a cause.
